newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castorseed prices up on overseas interest.
newsitem.headline: Indian castorseed prices up on overseas interest.

text.p: Indian castorseed September delivery prices on Monday rose to 1,142/1,143 rupees per quintal from 1,134 rupees on fresh speculative buying and overseas interest, dealers said.
Daily arrivals of castorseed in the Gujarat region dropped to 4,000/5,000 bags (75 kg each) due to widespread heavy rain.
"Indian exporters had finalised deals to export 4,000 tonnes of castoroil last week and fresh enquiries are continuing," one dealer said.
Groundnut oil moved up from 356/357 rupees to 361/362 rupees per 10 kg amid limited arrivals due to heavy rain in producing centres while consumer buying dragged prices up.
In Rajkot spot groundnut oil rose by five rupees to 555 rupees per 15 kg.
In Bombay imported palm oil fell to 261/262 rupees per 10 kg from 264/265 rupees as fresh arrivals at the port prompted profit-taking by local importers.
